body:
Mostapha, Chris We are getting some weird results out of a solar fan calculation: The solar fan should connect with all the sun vectors - seen in the Rhino Screenshot below but it only connected with 4. This is happening because the boolean union operation on line of the 236 fails to return all 7 curves passed in and instead it only returns 4. I am wondering should we re-write this component so it will return everything even if the boolean union doesnt work? Is the boolean union really necessary? Cheers, Anton [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/nIpONWN3T1bRR6J7KrnV9QzMdZlnULUuDwPwcwVPR9M*mRz2QJ16pJiEIq0DWFVA8v7mCQR135Mm0LC53GbCO6t-*1VNoCKM/Sunpathwith7planes.JPG)[
](http://api.ning.com:80/files/nIpONWN3T1ZpjFt7oxhO-m8qUn4gY1QGiGPQHlz1fLLqeFKDhc9BG28p7Vz6S-P8sk4*Qh1u778p54yfW661ofYqyVBoSAtY/SunVectorProblem.gh)
